  • India
  • Helicopter Packages in India

Delhi Tour Packages

Delhi is rich in history, from its Heritage buildings to its palaces competing with its cutting-edge skyscrapers and trendy shops. Read More

The city is where the past and future crystallize and epitomize in the most wonderful forms. Walk around and let's help you uncover in storytelling where each corner and crevice hides priceless treasures and each street is lined with past stories.

The Ancient Trails:

First stop, Old Delhi! Imagine for a second several blocks of narrow streets with the smell of various tasty foods and the sound of the packed crowd. There, you can admire the Jama Masjid, which is a beautiful mosque with splendid domes. The awe-inspiring Red Fort is the next, a place of monumental importance and history. Furthermore, cast a glance at Qutub Minar, an old monument that towers high and carries lots of stories within itself.

The Modern Marvels:

We move our focus now to New Delhi and see everything glistening and brand new. In this place, you can probably observe super-high skyscrapers and government facades. The Presidential Palace or the Rashtrapati Bhavan, in which the President lives, is a very beautiful building! Additionally, if you count yourself among shopaholics then New Delhi is a paradise with a variety of malls located here where you can get a hold of many products which must be discovered and owned.

A Feast for the Senses: A Feast for the Senses:

No doubt though, have some good food also. The rich food is what makes Delhi a heaven for every food enthusiast! Away from spicy street food like chaat, there is equally rich Mughlai food to please every mood or requirement. So come on, take a bite, and let your taste buds go on the tour.

Dive into Culture:

Lastly, let's head to the cultural part of Delhi and explore it in-depth. Walk to Lodhi Colony, a street where every stone is aching to serve as a means of expression. Visit the city museums and galleries, which are a wonderful avenue to learn about the history and tradition of Delhi.

Indeed the land of Delhi is full of millions of stories and memories; it is the place from which we begin the day with a million attentions. On the other hand, those memories you have kept in your heart will become lifetime ones as time passes. Shall we wander in this magical city those beautiful whispers of the past to you while loudly calling you to go forward? Hello from Delhi, where you will experience a new exciting moment all the time!

Table of Contents

  • Top Delhi Tour Packages
  • Highlights of Delhi Tour Packages
  • How to Reach Delhi
  • Best Time to Visit Delhi
  • Top places to explore in Delhi

Top Delhi Tour Packages in 2024

Tour Packages Tour Duration Tour Price
Delhi Agra Tour Package 3 Days / 2 Nights INR 18,900
Delhi Jaipur Tour Package 2 Days / 1 Night INR 7,900

Haridwar Rishikesh Tour from Delhi 2 Days / 1 Night INR 6,900
Delhi Jaipur Tour Package 2 Days / 1 Night INR 7,900
Delhi Sightseeing Tour Package 01 Day (Full Day) INR 4,900

Highlights of Delhi Packages

  • Delhi has always been a hub of culture while the megalopolis’ past space of many ethnicities weaving together is full of stories hundreds and even thousands of years old.
  • It simply exudes a unique blend of old and new, classic and contemporary. Embracing a whole spectrum of tastes and propensities.
  • Because we have spiritual, historical & political interests here, we will travel to Central Delhi next. There we can see the Raj Ghat, India Gate, Bangla Sahib, Rashtrapati Bhavan, and the Parliament House, which are all located in proximity.
  • Delhi tourism offers several occasions to experience its kaleidoscope of festivals, lip-smacking food, majestic monuments, sparkling museums, and nightlight flamboyance.
  • The city appeals to all classes of visitors encompassing families and couples that are differentiated by various types of tourist attractions.
  • The journey to Delhi can be made very economical by having low-budget travel packages curated by experts and accessible by all the major cities like Mumbai, Bangalore, Chennai, and Kolkata.

How to reach Delhi

Delhi offers diverse transport options. The diversity of Indira Gandhi International Airport set the scene for air travel links to main cities by the already existing railway network, and enjoying efficient travel inside the city with buses, taxis, Metro, and eco-friendly options for all.

Reaching Delhi by Air

Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport provides robust air connectivity because it operates domestic and international flights. Departures from Terminals 1D and 3 correspond to different airlines and offer outstanding service through shuttle buses, metro, and taxi pre-booking for onward travel to the city center.

Reaching Delhi by Train

Delhi’s railway network including principal stations like New Delhi, Old Delhi, and Nizamuddin makes it possible to connect several cities from different parts of the country. Upon getting into the station travelers can easily get a taxi, take a Metro, or use the buses of DTC for the local transport.

Reaching Delhi by Road

Delhi has a well-established network of roads linking it with the neighboring states and cities using buses and private motor cars. Interstate bus terminals and national highways have options for traveling to Delhi and beyond, from short to long distances.

Travelling within Delhi

Delhi's local transport has many varieties. You have many options like DTC buses, taxis, Metro, auto rickshaws, and eco-friendly like electric rickshaws and smart bikes. Each transportation system has its particular purpose for travelers, ensuring accessibility and convenience in the busy streets.

Best Time to Visit Delhi

Delhi's seasons promise varied experiences: summer mango festivals and indoor fun, monsoon rejuvenating art gallery visits and park explorations, winter demanding festive mood, and sightseeing in smog being a necessity with season-specific safety measures.

Season Temperature Weather Highlights Why Visit Things to Know
Summer 24°C - 40°C Warm, Humid Best for Luxury spas, Indoor Ice Skating, Bars and Clubs, Delhi Summer drinks and ice- creams, Karting, etc. It's time for the International Mango Festival. Enjoy Fun- filled activities with your loved ones Expect higher prices for things, stay hydrated, play indoor activities, and visit all the museums, art galleries, etc.
Monsoon 26°C - 35°C Pleasing, rainy Visiting art galleries, museums, Parks, road trips, North Indian cuisines, Rooftop restaurants and cafes, etc. It’s time for Red Earth’s Monsoon Festival Enjoy the refreshing weather and visit all the parks in Delhi Carry Umbrella and mosquito repellent cream. You will get good deals on hotels this time. Visit all the parks for nature’s best views.
Winter 8°C - 24°C Delightful, Smoggy Lake Tours, Monuments, heritage walks, shopping Bird watching, street food, Delhi Haat, etc It’s time for Christmas, New Year, etc. Festive vibes, complete sightseeing of major attractions without the scorching heat of summer. Enjoy street food. Enjoy amazing sightseeing in Delhi, and beware of smog. Carry woolen clothes and warm layers.

Top places to explore in Delhi

Delve into historical gems such as Humayun’s Tomb, take in the street food delights in Chandni Chowk, and enjoy the vibrant nightlife at Hauz Khas Village, sampling the best of the city through the lively markets and serene parks.

Historical Monuments

Humayun’s Tomb :

It was Mirak Mirza Ghiya that designed Humayun's tomb which is a clear manifestation of the eternal love between Mughal emperor Humayun and his first wife, Empress Haji Begum. The mausoleum which guards the graves of both rulers is a popular tourist site visited by people across the globe for its magic appearance and beautiful natural surroundings in the form of a well-maintained lawn and the addition of a lovely fountain.

Qutub Minar :

The Qutub Minar is a 73-foot-tall monument that has been here almost as long as the history of the Delhi Sultanate. It is the forehead of India's medieval epoch, which adorns the city skyline and is proudly referenced as the world's tallest brick minaret by the UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Red Fort :

Delhi's heartbeat is the majestic Red Fort, the Mughals' architectural masterpiece. The imposing red sandstone walls, where Shah Jahan resided, showcase a subtle blend of Islamic, Hindu, Persian, and Timurid design features.

Museums

Air force Museum

Check into New Delhi's Air Force Museum to understand the story of the Indian Air Force. Interactive memorials, photos, and artifacts presented in different ways allow visitors a memorable experience. Don't forget to visit the Roll of Honor, where the heroes are being remembered who gave their lives during crucial military actions.

Craft Museum

Delhi's National Crafts Museum & Hastkala Academy house unique artifacts featuring traditional crafts such as textiles and clay figures. Sited across the lane from Pragati Maidan, and designed by the great Charles Correa, it showcases India's rich heritage of crafting.

National Science Center Museum

A place that can be enjoyed by one and all, while on a trip in Delhi, is the National Museum of India. Founded in 1949, the institute boasts an expansive repository of artefacts that date as far back as the ancient civilizations. Relics from across India and the world have been curated by the museum over the last six decades, and displayed here inquisitive minds to explore to their heart’s content. From manuscripts to numismatics, jewellery to textiles, there’s every form of historic creation to be found here, giving you a unique glimpse into past eras of human cultural evolution. Aside from the exhibits, the National Museum is also a learning centre and knowledge repository. 

National Science Museum

The National Science Centre, named "Dream Castle for One and All," is one of the largest science centers in Asia. Spreading from 8 floors, it displays interactive science exhibits and showcases architectural history.

It comprises structures such as the Heritage & Dinosaur Gallery and Human Biology Gallery that visitors of all age groups will surely find interesting.

APJ Abdul Kalam Memorial

The Kalam Memorial inaugurated at Dilli Haat, INA on July 30th, 2016, pays tribute to the life and achievements of Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam. It becomes a symbol of our love for 'People's President,' which continues to stimulate visitors, mostly the young Indians.

Tibet House Museum

The Tibet House Museum embodies the cultural treasure and artistic heritage of Tibet. Offers a diverse collection of thankas (holy paintings), ancient currency notes, headwear, prayer items, and musical instruments. The structure in addition to the library there is a store that sells Tibetan arts and crafts.

Places to Enjoy Street Food

Chandni Chowk

Paranthe wali Gali, Kuremal Mohan Lal Kulfi Wale- Khan Omelette Corner, etc.

Jama Masjid

Karim’s

Connaught Place

Nazim’s Kathi Roll, Mutton Curry at Kake Da Hotel and other Cafes, Jain Chawal Wale, etc

Chawdi Bazaar

Lotan Chole Wala, Daulat Ki chaat, Puri of Shyam sweets etc.

Kamla Nagar

Aloo Tikki Wala , Vaishno Chaat Bhandar, Chache Di Hatti, etc.

Greater Kailash

Prince Paan and Chaat Corner

Places to Visit in Delhi at Night

Chandni Chowk

Chandni Chowk is a vibrant street that is always buzzing with activity. The twists and turns of these narrow streets are lined with small business owners who sell a variety of snacks, sweets, savory dishes, or affordable outfits to shoppers.

Hauz Khas Village

To feel the energy of old and new coexisting, visit Hauz Khas Village, which has a vibrant nightlife and historic reservoirs. The area has many pubs, clubs, and restaurants.

Gurudwara Bangla Sahib

Sikh spirituality is epitomized by Gurudwara Bangla Sahib, which is distinguished by its peaceful and uninterrupted (24/7) prayer services. The quiet pond makes it look even more appealing, so this place should be visited, especially at night.

Kingdom of Dreams

Walk into the Kingdom of Dreams in Gurgaon, just outside Delhi to experience the cultural immersion. This entertainment center combines Indian heritage in music through its performances. The food offering is simply yummy. Overall, the place becomes magical, more so at night.

Parks in Delhi

Deer park

A popular morning walking spot, Deer Park consists of Picnic Huts and is located close to Hauz Khas village. Delhi Lawn Tennis Association is a stone's throw away from it.

Garden of Five Senses

The garden is particularly well known for its green features, artwork placements, and statues, immersing its visitors in a sensuous experience. Important aspects such as the Khaas Bagh spiral walkway which imitates Mughal gardens and the Neel Bagh water lily pool which features a singing tree encircled by water.

Jahanpanah City Forest

Encompassing about 170 hectares of South Delhi, Jahanpanah City Forest combines nature with the old architecture. Apart from many bird species and animals that call their home, including jackals and nilgai, it is a peaceful neighborhood away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Lodhi Garden

Spread on 90 acres Lodhi Garden is a peaceful paradise amid the city's hectic hustle and bustle. It has large meadows, plenty of flower beds, and wooded grounds that bring people here for walks, picnics, and to take a break.

Mughal garden

The Mughal Gardens which are a part of the Rashtrapati Bhavan Complex are ablaze with gorgeous floral displays. Conceived by Edwin Lutyens, the harmonious combination of the Mughal and British styles is on display for your pleasure between February and March.

Kalindi Kunj

The park of Kalindi Kunj provides places for leading a healthy lifestyle with chances for walking, jogging, and game activities, as well as relaxation spots. The fact that it also hosts an amusement park further increases its popularity as a major attraction point for families and fitness buffs.
